items.title: Neutron Imaging of Additively Manufactured Parts: Ensuring Consistency in Advanced Metal Fabrication
October 2025 US Cutting Tool Orders Total $250.1M, Up 14.7% From October 2024
items.summary:
- October 2025 cutting tool shipments totaled $250.1 million; orders up 12.7% from September 2025 and 14.7% from October 2024.
- YTD through October shipments reached $2.13 billion, up 0.6% vs. 2024, marking the first positive YTD trend this year.
- Outlook: 2026 expected to be better than 2025, with potential policy changes and one-time factors supporting near-term gains.

items.title: Quality Caption Contest # 2 Winner
Fixtures: Traditional vs. Modular Tooling Features and Benefits
items.summary:
- Compares traditional welded fixtures with modular, reconfigurable tooling; traditional fixtures are rugged for stamping, while modular systems enable rapid changes and reduce inspection interference.
- Highlights modular fixturing for laser scanning and CMM inspection due to accuracy, ease of use, early data access, and adapters that preserve cross-system accuracy.
- Covers ROI and constraints (part size/weight, transport, process), hybrids and expandable bases, plug-and-play grids, and the move toward reusable, data-driven fixtures.

items.title: Metrology Trends: Turning Precision into Performance
items.summary:
- Metrology shifts from focusing on instruments to becoming a strategic enabler, linking measurements with leadership decisions, MES/ERP, and customer outcomes.
- Measurement literacy and real-time action turn data into measurable improvements; data must be interpreted and acted upon, not just collected.
- Standardized data language, AI/IoT-driven inspection, and upstream integration enable proactive quality, faster launches, and a single truth across sites.

items.title: PODCAST | Trends in Robotics for the New Year
items.summary:
- 2026 is projected to be the year humanoid robotics and related software move from experimentation to production-floor deployment, with measurable impact on quality, handling, and production metrics.
- 2025 showed activity but deployment remains a work in progress; broader shop-floor automation and tighter orchestration of multiple automation pieces are expected.
- The challenge is shifting from labor-based dashboards to true process-level visibility, with instrumented machines and cross‑equipment data sharing becoming imperative in 2026.

items.title: The Next Generation of Six Sigma: Linking Continuous Improvement to Strategy
items.summary: • Generation 4 ties CI to enterprise strategy with four value levers (Revenue Enablement, Margin, Capital Efficiency, Experience) and a 2×2 project map; examples include a $250k savings project vs a $10M revenue launch.\n• Embedded governance turns CI into proactive investment via Portfolio Assessment, Opportunity Mapping, Funding, Reviews, and Sustainability; leadership acts as Strategic Multiplier.\n• Finance integration in Define/Measure, cadence reviews across CI and capital portfolios, and Strategy as the sixth Sigma; the 6σSV framework links financial strategy with improvement.

items.title: Hamar Laser Awarded U.S. Air Force Contract for Surface Plate Calibration System
items.summary:
- AFMETCAL awarded a multi-year contract to Hamar Laser Instruments for its L-703SP Surface Plate Calibration System, valued at over $2.6 million for up to 84 units across Air Force bases and Air National Guard locations.
- The L-703SP uses a geometry laser-based design with customizable software, straightedges, 0.38 in. measurement increments, and corner locating tools.
- Air Force testers deemed the system superior to electronic levels, enabling quick calibration, high repeatability, easy setup, and faster data collection than traditional methods.

items.title: How IA9101 and IA9104/1 Are Reshaping AS9100 Aerospace Quality Management
items.author: media@nsf.org (Amanda Brown)
items.summary: - IA9101 and IA9104/1 revise AS9100 certification, elevating auditor competency, certification-body standards, and risk-based auditing with longer audits.\n- Transition timelines require ongoing certifications, QMS upgrades, staff training, and new partnerships; SR-005 outlines steps.\n- Early adopters seek credibility and market advantage, while organizations face documentation burden and risk if they delay adaptation.

items.title: Naprotek Appoints Filteau CEO
items.summary:
- Naprotek named Tim Filteau as CEO to lead a transition blending proven leadership with innovation.
- A bold EMS strategy aims to position Naprotek as a strategic partner and expand capabilities through SemiGen's RF/microwave, thin film, and semiconductor services.
- Filteau aims to deepen customer partnerships, accelerate global growth, and help customers thrive while advancing Naprotek's innovation agenda in RF and digital markets.

items.title: Through a Glass Darkly: A Sneak Peek at ISO/DIS 9001:2025
items.summary:
- Overview: ISO 9001 is being revised to 2025 with a DIS draft by ISO TC 176; public comments via member countries, moving toward FDIS after feedback.
- Key changes: leadership and culture emphasis, risk/opportunity focus, stronger controls for externally provided products/services, documented information, and expanded performance evaluation; Annex B deleted.
- Context and author: article by Andy Nichols of Quality-Nation, a long-time ISO 9001 practitioner with extensive CQI/lead auditor credentials.

items.title: Welcome to the Quality Caption Contest #3!
items.summary: - Promote a caption contest for a Koala T. Bear photo featuring a popular quality engineer.\n- Readers submit witty, heartwarming, or thought-provoking captions (no vulgar content); entries via a form.\n- Winners earn bragging rights and publication in Quality; reprint options include high-res PDFs or custom plaques.

items.title: Department of Commerce Announces Transition of Baldrige Performance Excellence Program
items.summary:
- NIST will transfer most operational Baldrige Program activities to private-sector partners while retaining ultimate responsibility for the Baldrige Framework, the Award process, and related statutory requirements.
- The transition covers the Award process, Quest for Excellence, framework revisions, and the Executive Fellows Program, aiming to expand resources and broaden reach across sectors.
- Leadership notes describe it as a milestone that preserves rigor and integrity while expanding stability; the 2025 Baldrige Award cycle will be completed and recipients announced soon.

items.title: How Data and AI Are Reshaping the Work of Aerospace Quality Engineers
items.summary:
- AI-enabled aerospace inspection handles vast multimodal data (vision, 3D, CT) and links results to digital-thread systems for traceability and timely interventions.
- AI supports prevention and validation; humans verify and interpret outputs with bias/GR&R, drift monitoring, and bounded-context models.
- The future includes real-time, closed-loop control, edge-AI, multimodal platforms, and a shift to exception management while keeping humans central.

items.title: Robotics and Process Control: Building Quality Through Automation
Meet the NDT Expert of Las Vegas
items.author: bangertm@bnpmedia.com (Michelle Bangert)
items.summary:
- Greg Weaver's NDT career spans Navy, mining, turbine repair, and leadership at Weaver NDT and Phoenix Neutron Imaging.
- He advances resonance tech, performs field eddy current testing for Las Vegas helicopter teams, and advocates ASNT mentoring.
- The piece highlights rare defect segregation (1 in 10,000) and mentions reprint options plus Bangert's editorial role.

items.title: Longtime Tech Exec Jennings Joins Artemis Vision Board of Advisors
items.summary:
- John Jennings joins Artemis Vision's Board of Advisors, bringing 40+ years of tech leadership (most recently Basler CCO/Managing Director).
- He will help grow RaPTr, the track-and-trace solution for incoming/outgoing goods, and sharpen the go-to-market strategy.
- CEO Tom Brennan says Jennings' experience will refine sales methodology and accelerate RaPTr's market potential.

items.title: AI Trust Management: Why Quality Assurance Is the Heart of Artificial Intelligence
items.author: Greg@800Compete.com (Greg Hutchins)

items.title: ASQ Fellows Forum: A New Space for Shared Insight
items.author: dlbrecken@sbcglobal.net (Don Brecken)

items.title: The Quality Department of Tomorrow: From Guardian to Strategic Navigator
items.author: Dfep2@aol.com (Robert Ferrone)

items.title: Quality Management Systems
Ensuring Reliability in Data Centers: The Evolving Role of Leak Testing
Robotic Palletizing Stacks Up to Productivity and Profitability
items.summary:
- Modular palletizing cells (CARBON and CUBE) reduce labor risk and speed deployment, with CARBON in 1 day and CUBE in hours.
- KUKA KR QUANTEC and KR 50/70 IONTEC robots provide six axes, flexible end-effectors, smaller footprints, and easier reconfiguration for productivity.
- Software and remote tools (KUKA.WorkVisual, KUKA.Sim, KUKA.SafeOperation, KUKA.RemoteSupportView) enable safe operation, fast commissioning, and remote maintenance.

items.title: IACMI Launches ‘Make It In America’ National Outreach Campaign
items.summary:
- IACMI launched Make It In America to raise awareness of advanced manufacturing careers and help fill an estimated 3.8 million jobs by 2030.
- The campaign leverages ACE and METAL to educate job seekers about opportunities and the sector’s local/global importance, with free online and in-person training.
- An annual award spotlights a company and employee with a modern manufacturing mindset; since 2020, over 5,000 graduates from 50+ partners.

items.title: Best Practices in the Care, Use, and Maintenance of Thread and Cylindrical Gages
items.author: sharlar@hemcogages.com (Sharla Rouwhorst)
items.summary:
- Proper handling, cleaning, calibration, and inspection of thread and cylindrical gages; protect during transit and record intake and calibration dates for traceability.
- Use GO gages with fingertip pressure only; never force into a part, follow GO/NOGO practice, calibrate regularly, and store gages individually in protected locations.
- Track wear history by material and usage to optimize calibration timing; train staff on care and handling to reduce costs and rejects.

items.title: VIDEO PODCAST | Accelerate Your Career with ASQ Certifications
items.summary:
- ASQ certifications unlock potential, accelerate career growth, and add value to society by serving as a global gold standard that enhances credibility and can yield salary and leadership benefits, along with intangible advantages.
- Certification exams are a marathon—roughly five hours—requiring prep, consistency, studying the body of knowledge, trusting the process, and pacing oneself.
- Ramp up gradually and leverage ASQ resources such as question banks, e-learning, and books to support career advancement and certification achievement.

items.title: What a True Digital Twin Is—and What It Isn’t
items.summary:
- A true digital twin is an evolving model anchored in measured geometry, blending verified scans with live sensor, maintenance, and environment data rather than a static CAD snapshot.
- Metrology provides the geometry anchor via laser trackers, 3D/CT scans, and calibration; sensors supply condition data, but geometry must come from measurement to avoid drift.
- Benefits include predictive maintenance and better decisions across sectors; take-away: scans capture snapshots, while the twin evolves through precise measurement and continuous data integration.

items.title: Favorable Economic Outlook for 2026 Touted as Fed Cuts Rates
items.summary:
- Fed trimmed rates by 25 bps to 3.50%–3.75%, with Powell saying inflation and unemployment trends are largely unchanged from October.
- FOMC tensions remain, with dissent and some members favoring no change, while SEP projections push 2026 GDP to 2.3% and inflation staying above 2% for years.
- AMT notes stronger machinery orders could lift 2026 tool demand; USMTO monitoring and AMT's Winter Economic Forum on Jan 30 are highlighted.

items.title: Mastering the Upward Spiral of Improvement
items.author: smith_jim_l@cat.com (Jimmy L. Smith)
items.summary:
- Advocates slow, steady improvement over heroic change, using Juran’s spiral and Covey’s Upward Spiral to lift learning and performance.
- Notes that a truly corporate CAPA system can create competitive advantage when it adds value; pace change to avoid burnout.
- Urges balancing speed and stability to sustain momentum and deliver a consistent climb across processes.

items.title: How a Quality Engineering Job Became a Career—and Ultimately a Passion
items.summary:
- Jim Spichiger, a Lean Six Sigma Master Black Belt with 35+ years in quality and a former chair of the ASQ Inspection Division.
- He earned the CQE, completed a local ASQ prep course, renewed via recertification units, and advanced through ASQ volunteering to leadership and multiple certifications.
- The piece shows how a passion for quality drives career growth, personal satisfaction, financial rewards, and lasting peer relationships.

items.title: 1.7 Million Pins Per Day: Milestone in Connector Control
items.summary:
- Aku.automation and AT Sensors deploy a 3D pin-inspection system for automotive connectors, handling 1.7M pins daily across up to 40 machines.
- XCS dual-head sensor scans from two sides with a 53 mm FOV and Clean Beam to ensure stable laser intensity, enabling tiny surface-detail detection.
- AI-powered aku.visionManager delivers readable quality data with MultiPart and MultiPeak; defect pin rejection stays under 1% and supports many connector types.

items.title: From Waste to Worth: AI-Powered Recycling Takes Off
items.summary:
- AI-powered sorting uses computer vision and deep learning to identify and sort materials on fast conveyors, enabling autonomous, high-recovery sorters with live monitoring.
- Forecasts long-term AI-enabled infrastructure with performance-based pricing, aiming 90%+ recovery and mixed-waste sorting to cut costs and extend landfill life.
- Delivers safety gains, enables recycling where curbside access is limited, and accelerates Circular Economy through plant-wide optimization and recovered-material markets.

items.title: The New Era of Manufacturing: Job Seekers Express Growing Optimism
US Metalworking Machinery Orders Surge 40% Year-Over-Year in October
items.summary:
- October 2025 U.S. metalworking machinery orders reached $538.9M, up 9% from September and 40.3% YoY, with year-to-date at $4.47B (+19.7%).
- October had the highest order value and units since March 2023; third 2025 month above $500M, aided by renewed tax incentives and steady demand from consumers and government.
- Aerospace, engines, turbines and power equipment orders rose to multi-year highs, signaling near-term activity; data-center demand supports expansion.
